name: HTMLInputElement
description: The HTMLInputElement interface provides special properties and methods for manipulating the layout and presentation of input elements.

members.name: HTMLInputElement.align
members.description: string: represents the alignment of the element. Use CSS instead.

members.name: HTMLInputElement.useMap
members.description: string: represents a client-side image map.

members.name: HTMLInputElement.stepDown()
members.description: Decrements the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified. Throws an INVALID_STATE_ERR exception: if the method is not applicable to for the current type value, if the element has no step value, if the value cannot be converted to a number, if the resulting value is above the max or below the min.

members.name: HTMLInputElement.stepUp()
members.description: Increments the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified. Throws an INVALID_STATE_ERR exception: if the method is not applicable to for the current type value., if the element has no step value, if the value cannot be converted to a number, if the resulting value is above the max or below the min.

members.name: HTMLInputElement.mozSetFileArray()
members.description: Sets the files selected on the input to the given array of File objects.  This is an alternative to mozSetFileNameArray() which can be used in frame scripts: a chrome script can open files as File objects and send them via message manager.

members.name: HTMLInputElement.mozGetFileNameArray()
members.description: Returns an array of all the file names from the input.

parameters.name: aLength
parameters.description: If specified, will receive the number of file names in the returned array.

parameters.name: aFileNames
parameters.description: Is an array into which the file names are placed.

members.name: HTMLInputElement.mozSetFileNameArray()
members.description: Sets the filenames for the files selected on the input.  Not for use in frame scripts, because it accesses the file system.

parameters.name: aFileNames
parameters.description: Is the array of file names to apply to the element.

parameters.name: aLength
parameters.description: Is the number of file names in the array.
